channel.title: Auteria
channel.description:
I just started playing this game a couple hours ago. And I mean it's nothing spectacular, but it's fairly enjoyable and it's low on system requirements. If anyone else plays, or would like to play, here's a link to their website.
http://auteria.com/[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 28, 2009, 09:25:29 pm[/size][hr]They have a Christmas event going on till Jan. 6, they've got Reindeer you can ride, Santa Hats, etc. It's also for many different OS's.

item.title: Auteria
item.dc:creator: @Cruzer Cruzer
item.description:
@Cruzer wrote:

the fuck is this shit

Read full topic

item.title: Auteria
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Yeah, for the most part the game is solely based around doing quests. But the skills are like an afterthought almost. The games actually been out for like 2 years, but has been in beta this whole time.

Read full topic

item.title: Auteria
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Elijah, post:3, topic:322624”][quote author=jme link=topic=419016.msg3080130#msg3080130 date=1262103610]
So pretty much all there is to do is fight monsters/do quests ?
[/quote]

You can harvest Wood, Stone, Herbs, etc. And then make goods and perform services with those raw materials. Black smithing, Potion making, Cloth making, Food Making, etc. But to do those skills you have to complete quests to learn how to do them.[/quote]

99% of mmorpg’s coming out are just fighting monsters/quests so I was just asking. That sounds pretty decent I guess

Read full topic

item.title: Auteria
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

jme:

So pretty much all there is to do is fight monsters/do quests ?

You can harvest Wood, Stone, Herbs, etc. And then make goods and perform services with those raw materials. Black smithing, Potion making, Cloth making, Food Making, etc. But to do those skills you have to complete quests to learn how to do them.

Read full topic
